hints.content:
We can think of $\purpleC{560}$ as $\purpleC{5\text{ hundreds}}$ and $\purpleC{6 \text{ tens}}$.  

We can think of $\blueD{336}$ as $\blueD{3\text{ hundreds}}$, $\blueD{3\text{ tens}}$, and $\blueD{6\text{ ones}}$.

$\phantom{=}\purpleC{560}+\blueD{336}$

$=\purpleC{5\text{ hundreds}}+\purpleC{6\text{ tens}}+\blueD{3\text{ hundreds}}+\blueD{3\text{ tens}}+\blueD{6\text{ ones}}$

$= \purpleC{5\text{ hundreds}}+\blueD{3\text{ hundreds}}+\purpleC{6\text{ tens}}+\blueD{3\text{ tens}}+\blueD{6\text{ ones}}$
The answer: $5\text{ hundreds} + 3\text{ hundreds} +6 \text{ tens}+3\text{ tens} +6 \text{ ones}$

question.content:
**Which addition problem is the same as $560+336$?**
